title: Markdown Syntax Guide
summary: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

title: How to Clone Your Company's Project Repository
summary:
Introduction When joining a new team or starting a new role, one of your first tasks might be to clone the company‚Äôs codebase so you can start contributing. This article walks you through the process of cloning a private Git/GitLab repository used in a professional environment ‚Äî securely and correctly.
üîê Prerequisites: Before you can clone the repo, make sure you have:
Access permissions to the repository (usually granted by an admin or team lead). A GitLab or GitHub account with access to the organization/project. Git installed on your machine (git --version should return a version number). SSH key added to your Git provider (recommended for secure authentication). ‚úÖ Step-by-Step to Cloning a Repo 1. Get the Repository URL Log into your company's Git platform (e.g., GitLab, GitHub, Bitbucket). Navigate to the project repository and copy the SSH or HTTPS clone URL.

title: Math Typesetting
summary: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

title: Rich Content
summary: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

title: Emoji Support
summary: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
